basics.name: Jean-Sébastien Renaud
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I am in 3rd year student in Computer Science in CentraleSupélec, Supélec formation (high ranked French engineering school). My involvement in the association Supélec Rézo as a regular member, then an administrator, secretary and president depicts my growing interest for computer science. Supélec Rézo allowed me to develop several skills among architecture, information systems management, development, working with professional hardware or managing voluntary teams working on long term projects. Finally, I recently came to like web development as both a back-end and a front-end developer thanks to my personal and academic projects. I am therefor searching a 6 month end-of-studies internship, outside of France, in this field starting in April 2016.

work.summary: Pied Piper is a multi-platform technology based on a proprietary universal compression algorithm that has consistently fielded high Weisman Scores™ that are not merely competitive, but approach the theoretical limit of lossless compression.
highlights: Build an algorithm for artist to detect if their music was violating copy right infringement laws
Optimized an algorithm that holds the current world record for Weisman Scores

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.
